skill.name: uniprot-database
skill.description: Direct REST API access to UniProt. Protein searches, FASTA retrieval, ID mapping, Swiss-Prot/TrEMBL. For Python workflows with multiple databases, prefer bioservices (unified interface to 40+ services). Use this for direct HTTP/REST work or UniProt-specific control.
skill.summary: Direct REST API access to UniProt. Protein searches, FASTA retrieval, ID mapping, Swiss-Prot/TrEMBL....
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or execution primitives were found. Network calls are limited to documented UniProt REST endpoints for expected functionality.

content.user_title: Query UniProt proteins via REST API
content.value_statement: Finding accurate protein data across identifiers is slow. This skill queries UniProt and maps IDs with concise REST workflows.
actual_capabilities: Retrieve single protein entries in multiple formats
Stream large result sets without pagination
List available fields and mapping databases
Batch retrieve multiple accessions via query
limitations: ID mapping supports up to 100,000 IDs per job
Large streams require careful local storage handling
Response formats limited to UniProt API options

use_cases.title: Curate reviewed protein lists
use_cases.description: Build Swiss-Prot datasets by organism and functional filters.

use_cases.title: Fetch FASTA sequences
use_cases.description: Download sequences for a list of accessions for lab workflows.

use_cases.title: Normalize identifiers
use_cases.description: Map external IDs to UniProt for downstream pipelines.

prompt_templates.title: Basic protein search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search UniProt for insulin proteins in Homo sapiens that are reviewed. Return accessions and gene names in TSV.

prompt_templates.title: Get FASTA by accession
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the FASTA sequence for accession P01308 and provide the header details.

prompt_templates.title: ID mapping job
prompt_templates.prompt: Map UniProt accessions P01308 and P04637 to PDB IDs and summarize the results.

prompt_templates.title: Stream large dataset
prompt_templates.prompt: Stream all reviewed human proteins in FASTA and suggest chunk handling for large downloads.

output_examples.input: Search reviewed human BRCA1 entries and return accessions and organism names.
output: - Found 1 reviewed entry for BRCA1 in Homo sapiens
- Returned accession P38398 with organism name
- Provided TSV-ready column list for export

best_practices: Use reviewed:true for high quality Swiss-Prot data
Request only needed fields to reduce payload size
Use stream endpoint for large result sets
anti_patterns: Fetching all fields when only a few are needed
Ignoring rate limits during batch queries

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is designed for text prompts and Python workflows in these platforms.

faq.question: What are the query and mapping limits?
faq.answer: ID mapping supports up to 100000 IDs per job. Search size is limited by UniProt API settings.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, use the Python client functions and REST endpoints in batch scripts.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it only sends your queries to UniProt and returns responses.

faq.question: What should I do if a request fails?
faq.answer: Check your query syntax, format choice, and retry with smaller batches.

faq.question: How does this compare to bioservices?
faq.answer: This is UniProt specific with direct REST control. Bioservices offers a broader multi database interface.
